title: US to help Pak upgrade its F-16s: Trump admin clears $686m deal; a message for India?
content: The Trump administration has notified Congress of a $686 million package to modernise Pakistan's F-16 fleet, including avionics upgrades and tactical data links. This move, aimed at enhancing interoperability for counterterrorism, comes amid strained US-India ties and follows Pakistan's recent diplomatic efforts with Washington.

title: Family rift widens as Lalu daughter appeals to Nitish Kumar for 'safe home'
content: Lalu Prasad's daughter, Rohini Acharya, has voiced concerns about women's safety in Bihar, advocating for parental homes to be secure havens.  Her appeal follows a public fallout with her family, where she alleged accusations of ulterior motives behind her kidney donation to her father. Acharya believes societal and political shifts are crucial to protect women from exploitation.

title: Can't copy-paste old voter lists for SIR: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court emphasised that electoral roll revisions must be thorough, not mere copies. The Election Commission's voter enumeration process will involve inquiries to confirm citizenship, rather than waiting for complaints.  The Court noted migration as a valid reason for nationwide roll updates, even without specific statistics, and dismissed claims of arbitrariness in the selection of states for the exercise.

title: Mass visa chaos: H-1B families stranded in India; US consulates cancel interviews
content: Hundreds of Indian H-1B visa holders and their families are stranded in India due to a new US Department of State policy mandating social-media screening. This has led to mass cancellations and rescheduling of visa appointments, pushing many into 2026, jeopardizing jobs and disrupting family lives.

title: Amazon layoffs: VP explains 14,000 jobs cuts; Done to remove organisational layers
content: Amazon's senior vice president Amit Agarwal stated that recent layoffs are aimed at removing organizational layers to foster agility, enabling the company to operate like a startup in an AI-driven world. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts are culture-driven, not financially or AI-driven, to streamline operations and empower employees.

title: 5 of 8 names listed were from disadvantaged sections: Govt
content: The government has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of marginalization in Central Information Commission appointments. Sources state that five out of eight recommended candidates are from disadvantaged sections, including SC, ST, OBC, and minority communities. The government highlighted past UPA inaction on SC/ST appointments, contrasting it with NDA's appointments, including the first SC CIC.

title: SC rejects plea to suspend Sanjiv Bhatt's 20-yr jail term in '96 drug-planting case
content: The Supreme Court has denied former IPS officer Sanjiv Bhatt's plea to suspend his 20-year jail sentence in a 1996 drug planting case. Bhatt, convicted by a Gujarat court, sought bail but the bench declined his request. The case involves allegations of framing a lawyer in Palanpur, with Bhatt accused of planting drugs to settle a property dispute.

title: Sam Altman pushes Oracle into first-ever $10bn burn and fresh borrowing spree
content: Oracle's stock experienced a significant drop after reporting quarterly results that missed revenue expectations, largely due to substantial spending on data centers for AI customers like OpenAI. The company's heavy reliance on a massive OpenAI deal and its debt-fueled expansion have raised investor concerns about its financial stability and future growth prospects.

title: Hospitality, textiles sectors set to drive jobs growth: Study
content: Textiles, apparel, and hospitality are poised for significant job growth by 2030, fueled by increased investment, a new report reveals.  While manufacturing and services will also contribute, the focus is on boosting stable, salaried positions.  The think tank urges a strategic approach, emphasizing skill development and addressing the informal sector's dominance to enhance labor absorption and drive economic expansion.

title: Anurag Thakur says TMC MP vapes in House, stirs uproar
content: Lok Sabha proceedings saw a brief disruption when BJP MP Anurag Thakur alleged a Trinamool Congress member was repeatedly using an e-cigarette in the House. Speaker Om Birla, confirming no such permission was granted, assured action if the information is substantiated. The incident prompted calls for decorum and adherence to rules from the treasury benches.

title: ED searches 40 sites in 4 states for 'highly radicalised IS module'
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted extensive searches across 40 locations in Delhi, Kolkata, Maharashtra, and Uttar Pradesh targeting a radicalized IS module. Investigations revealed alleged use of crime proceeds for weapons, explosives, recruitment, and training of terror suspects. This money laundering probe stems from an NIA chargesheet, with intelligence suggesting illicit wood trade funding extremist activities.

title: Money mistakes: Kevin O’Leary warns consumers; the biggest financial trap people fall into unnoticed
content: Shark Tank's Kevin O'Leary warns homebuyers against purchasing oversized properties, calling it a significant financial pitfall. He advises keeping mortgage payments under a third of after-tax income to avoid becoming 'house poor.' O'Leary advocates for a staged approach, starting with a smaller home and upgrading later as finances strengthen, especially with current high mortgage rates.

title: We don't go by external rankings on climate, pollution: Govt
content: India prioritizes its own assessments for environmental policy over external global rankings on pollution and climate resilience. The Environment Ministry stated it doesn't recognize foreign reports like the Global Climate Risk Index or IQAir's air quality rankings as a basis for domestic policy. Instead, the nation relies on its own initiatives like 'Swachh Vayu Survekshan' for evaluating progress.

title: When love becomes a crime: What the Nanded killing reveals about ‘honour’ in modern India
content: A young inter-caste couple's tragic story highlights India's persistent 'honour killings.' Saksham Tate was murdered by his girlfriend Aanchal Mamidwar's family, who opposed their relationship. Despite arrests, the law lacks a specific 'honour killing' category, leaving a legal and social vacuum. This deeply rooted societal issue continues to claim lives, demanding a significant cultural shift.

title: Jeff Shiver: Father of Paige Shiver linked to Michigan HC Sherrone Moore
content: Whispers of Sherrone Moore's potential firing from Michigan have intensified, fueled by rumors of an alleged relationship with executive assistant Paige Shiver. The situation escalated with claims of Shiver's pregnancy and Moore being the father. Paige Shiver's father, Jeff Shiver, is a highly respected NFL scout with a storied career, as detailed in a 2019 profile.

title: Paige Shiver’s net worth: 55% salary hike and link to Sherrone Moore scandal fuel speculation
content: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Candace Owens hits back as Erika Kirk urges public to stop Charlie Kirk rumors
content: Erika Kirk pleaded for privacy regarding her husband Charlie Kirk's burial site on Fox News, citing fears of grave desecration. However, Candace Owens interpreted this plea as a veiled attack, claiming Kirk's words were directed at her. Owens continues to promote unverified theories about Kirk's assassination, despite official reports pointing to a lone gunman.

title: Venus Williams & Andrea Preti net worth 2025: Career, family & business
content: Venus Williams boasts an estimated $95 million net worth in 2025, primarily from her legendary tennis career and successful fashion and design businesses. Her partner, Andrea Preti, an actor and businessman, contributes an estimated $1-2 million. Together, their combined net worth is approximately $96-97 million, reflecting their individual financial achievements.

title: CeeDee Lamb injury: Cowboys expect quick recovery as WR clears concussion steps
content: Dallas Cowboys' star CeeDee Lamb is showing positive signs of recovery from a concussion sustained against the Detroit Lions. Executive VP Stephen Jones indicated Lamb is meeting necessary thresholds for play, with head coach Brian Schottenheimer also expressing optimism. While Lamb was a limited participant in practice, his return on Sunday remains unconfirmed.

title: IND vs SA: India crumble in 214 chase as South Africa level T20I series 1-1
content: South Africa leveled the T20I series 1-1 after defeating India by 51 runs in the second match. Quinton de Kock's explosive 90 powered South Africa to 213, a target India couldn't chase, faltering at 162 despite Tilak Varma's valiant 62. South Africa's bowlers consistently took wickets, stifling India's momentum.  Baartman took four wickets for South Africa.

title: EC extends SIR timeline in 6 states & UTs
content: The Election Commission has revised the schedule for the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in five states and a Union Territory following requests from chief electoral officers. New deadlines for submitting enumeration forms and publishing draft electoral rolls have been set, with the final rolls to be published in February 2026.

title: NHPC denies offering forest land as collateral to raise funds
content: NHPC is seeking an NOC from the environment ministry to use Subansiri Lower project assets for future debt financing without offering forest land as collateral. This clarification follows reports of the ministry rejecting a proposal, stating it was not tenable under the Forest Conservation Act.

title: Hydrogen fuel cell EVs transformative to shape India's clean future: Pralhad Joshi
content: India's clean energy journey received a significant boost as Union minister Pralhad Joshi launched a pilot project for hydrogen fuel cell electric vehicles (FCEVs) in the mobility sector.  An MoU between NISE and Toyota Kirloskar Motor will facilitate field trials of the Toyota Mirai, aiming to assess its performance across diverse Indian conditions and pave the way for wider adoption.

title: 5 daily habits that increase visceral fat and how to reduce them
content: Stubborn belly fat may be linked to hidden visceral fat, a dangerous internal fat.  Poor lifestyle habits like inactivity, processed foods, chronic stress, excessive alcohol, and lack of sleep contribute to its accumulation.  This internal fat poses serious health risks.  Discover simple, actionable tips to combat this harmful fat and improve your well-being.

title: Labour pangs back to haunt key J&K hydel project
content: Construction at the 850-MW Ratle Hydroelectric Project in Kishtwar faces a shutdown threat due to alleged political interference and demands for local hiring. Management warns of halting work amidst union disputes and pressure to employ inexperienced individuals, echoing past disruptions that caused significant delays and losses.

title: After cancer report, J&K leaders meet; orchard risks flagged; panel drafts action plan
content: Kashmir's apple farmers face a grave health crisis as studies reveal a strong link between pesticide exposure and malignant brain tumors. Decades of unchecked spraying, often exceeding recommended limits, have led to alarming incidences of cancer in fruit-growing districts. Lawmakers are now demanding urgent action to protect these vital workers.

title: 97 new VDG groups to fortify security grid in J&K's Reasi
content: Reasi Police have bolstered village-level defence by forming 97 new Village Defence Guard (VDG) groups. This initiative includes replacing 726 aged personnel and recruiting 1,902 new members to enhance security preparedness across the district's remote and sensitive areas.

title: Leh Apex Body faces public pushback as draft seeking statehood for Ladakh goes to debate
content: Ladakh's campaign for statehood and Sixth Schedule status intensified as the Leh Apex Body presented its draft proposal. While proponents advocate for greater autonomy, concerns were raised about the region's financial viability as a state. The draft also seeks amnesty for protesters and constitutional safeguards.

title: 'Sign on dotted line': Goyal's msg for US after trade aide's 'best offer' remark; pact soon?
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal welcomed US praise for trade deal offers, urging the US to finalize the agreement if satisfied.  Despite no timeline, Goyal highlighted ongoing discussions and the mutual benefit required for any deal.

title: IND vs SA: Gautam Gambhir furious as Arshdeep Singh bowls 7-wides in an over - Watch
content: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh struggled with his line and length during the second T20I against South Africa, bowling seven wides in a single over. This costly over, which included 13 deliveries and 13 runs, drew the ire of head coach Gautam Gambhir. India, leading the series 1-0, opted to bowl first after winning the toss.

title: 'Very warm conversation': PM Modi speaks with Donald Trump; trade, defence in focus
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Trump held a productive call, reviewing the robust India-US Comprehensive Global Strategic Partnership. Both leaders expressed satisfaction with growing bilateral cooperation and discussed enhancing trade, critical technologies, energy, and defense. They also committed to collaborating on regional and global issues, reinforcing their commitment to a deepening strategic alliance.

title: IND vs SA: 'Why not Samson?' - memes break internet as Gill flops again
content: Shubman Gill's T20I struggles persisted with a golden duck against South Africa, drawing criticism. Meanwhile, Quinton de Kock's explosive 90 powered the visitors to a formidable 213/4. India's bowlers, including Arshdeep Singh and Jasprit Bumrah, faced a tough outing, conceding heavily in the death overs, leaving the hosts with a challenging chase.

title: Goa nightclub fire: How the Luthra brothers were nabbed - a timeline
content: Goa nightclub co-owners Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra have been detained in Phuket, Thailand, and are being deported to India for investigation into a deadly fire that killed 25 people. Indian authorities coordinated the operation after the brothers fled the country shortly after the blaze, with a police team now in Thailand to take them into custody upon their return.

title: US-Russia flashpoint? Putin calls Maduro; reaffirms support amid Trump's rhetoric
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin reaffirmed Moscow's commitment to joint economic and energy projects with Venezuela during a call with President Nicolás Maduro. Putin also conveyed solidarity with Venezuela amidst US pressure, which Caracas denies is linked to drug cartels. The leaders emphasized deepening strategic cooperation, building on existing strong ties between the two nations.

title: Delhi riots case: Umar Khalid gets interim bail; why court gave relief
content: A Delhi court has granted interim bail to former JNU student leader Umar Khalid from December 16 to 29. This temporary relief allows him to attend his sister's wedding. Khalid, arrested under UAPA in the Delhi riots conspiracy case, will return to custody after the permitted period.

title: Gambhir's No.3 gamble fails; Axar departs cheaply in big chase
content: India's gamble of sending Axar Patel at number three backfired in the second T20I against South Africa. Patel struggled to find form, scoring 21 off 21 balls as wickets tumbled. South Africa posted a formidable 213/4, powered by Quinton de Kock's explosive 90. Varun Chakaravarthy was India's standout bowler with two wickets.

title: Impact of new labour codes: Does your salary, PF contribution & gratuity change? Explained
content: New labour codes are set to redefine wage calculations, impacting salary structures, PF contributions, and gratuity payouts. The broader definition of 'wages' means more components will be included, potentially increasing employee benefits and employer liabilities. Fixed-term employees now qualify for gratuity after one year of service.

title: Wd, wd, wd ...: Arshdeep's over stretches to infinity; bowls 7 wides
content: Indian bowler Arshdeep Singh struggled with his line and length during the second T20I against South Africa. He bowled seven wides in a single over, conceding 18 runs. The incident occurred in the 11th over of the South African innings. Head coach Gautam Gambhir appeared displeased with the performance. India won the toss and elected to bowl in the match.

title: PM Modi to embark on 3-country tour: Will visit Jordan, Ethiopia and Oman from Dec 15-18
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will undertake a four-day visit to Jordan, Ethiopia, and Oman from December 15-18. The trip aims to strengthen bilateral ties, explore new collaborations, and discuss regional issues, marking significant anniversaries in diplomatic relations with Jordan and Oman.

title: No relief for Goa club owners: Court denies interim bail; Thailand to deport Luthras soon
content: Delhi court denied transit anticipatory bail to Saurabh and Gaurav Luthras, owners of the Goa nightclub where a fatal fire occurred. The brothers sought protection to avoid immediate arrest upon returning from Thailand. Goa's counsel argued they were evading legal process, while the defense emphasized their willingness to cooperate with the investigation.

title: Trump's $1m Gold card: What it means for Indians, EB-5 visa aspirants; what you should know
content: US President Donald Trump has launched a new Gold Card program, requiring a $1 million donation for individuals or $2 million for corporations to gain legal status and a path to citizenship. This initiative aims to attract exceptional talent and generate government revenue, presenting an alternative to the EB-5 visa system.

title: Truck falls into gorge: 22 feared dead; authorities alerted when survivor emerges after 72hrs
content: Tragedy struck in Arunachal Pradesh as at least 22 Assam labourers are feared dead after their mini truck plunged into a deep gorge near the Indo-China border. A lone survivor, severely injured, alerted authorities after a perilous journey. Rescue operations are underway, with specialized teams and the Army working to retrieve bodies from the treacherous terrain.

title: New regional axis? B'desh hints willing to join bloc that excludes India; backs Pak's plan
content: Bangladesh's foreign affairs adviser stated it's strategically possible for Dhaka to join a regional grouping with Pakistan, excluding India, following Islamabad's signals for a trilateral initiative with China. He also noted progress on lifting US sanctions on RAB and dismissed the likelihood of further sanctions on Bangladeshi leaders.

title: Just Rs 100: ICC opens T20 World Cup ticket sales; prices set at 'historic low'
content: Ticket sales for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 have opened with entry-level prices starting at Rs 100 in India and LKR 1,000 in Sri Lanka. Co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka, the tournament aims for unprecedented accessibility with over 2 million tickets available. The event will feature 20 teams playing 55 matches across eight venues.

title: US Bringing Seized Tanker To Port As Venezuela War Fears Build
content: An oil tanker seized by American forces off the Venezuelan coast will be brought to a port in the United States, the White House said Thursday, as fears mount of open conflict between the two countries.

title: Still No Free Movement In Manipur? National Human Rights Commission Seeks Report
content: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) today ordered the police and civil authorities in Manipur's Kangpokpi district to give an action-taken report on a complaint about denial of safe passage through National Highway-2.

title: House Help Arrested For Theft Of Jewellery Worth Rs 3.5 Crore
content: Mumbai Police has arrested a domestic help for allegedly stealing jewellery and diamonds worth Rs 3.57 crore from the house of a 93-year-old woman who lives in Marine Drive area here.

title: OpenAI, Microsoft Sued For 'Encouraging' Mentally Challenged Man To Kill Mother
content: OpenAI and its largest financial backer, Microsoft, were sued in California state court on Thursday over claimsthat OpenAI's popular chatbot ChatGPT encouraged a mentally ill man to kill his mother and himself.

title: US Trade Gap Shrinks To Narrowest Since 2020 After Tariff Hikes
content: The US trade deficit narrowed unexpectedly in September to the smallest since 2020, delayed government data showed Thursday, with imports rising just slightly as President Donald Trump's new tariffs set in.

title: US Officials Threaten Jail, Family Separation To Force Migrants To Deport
content: The email from a US immigration officer presented Kelly and Yerson Vargas with a stark choice: accept deportation to their native Colombia or risk being charged with a crime and separated from their 6-year-old daughter, Maria Paola.

title: 'Downward Spiral': Woman Blames Social Media For 15-Year-Old Son's Suicide
content: A French mother whose teenage son took his own life is fighting to hold social media platforms accountable, saying their algorithms pushed suicide-related content that sent the 15-year-old into a "downward spiral".

title: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal Says US Trade Negotiations 'Progressing Well'
content: Negotiations are progressing well for the trade deal between India and the United States, and substantial discussions have taken place, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said on Thursday.

title: Husband In Indore, Pak Woman Begs Court To Deport Him To Prevent 2nd Marriage
content: A family dispute between a Pakistani Hindu husband-wife duo, each living in two different countries for a long time after their marriage in Pakistan in 2020, has reached the Madhya Pradesh High Court after attempts at reconciliation failed.

title: Thai PM's 'Return Power to People' Post Signals Parliament Dissolution
content: Thai leader Anutin Charnvirakul said late Thursday he "would like to return power to the people", a known signal in the kingdom that a prime minister intends to dissolve parliament, paving the way for fresh elections.

title: Putin Spoke To Venezuela's Maduro, Reaffirmed Support Amid US Tensions: Kremlin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday reaffirmed his support to Venezuela in a phone call with long-time ally President Nicolas Maduro after the United States seized an oil tanker off the country's coast, the Kremlin said.

title: Nobel Laureate Machado Says US Helped Her Leave Venezuela
content: Nobel Peace laureate Maria Corina Machado said on Thursday that the United States helped her get to Norway from hiding in Venezuela, expressing support for US military action against her country and vowing to return home.

title: 'Need To Align Policy With Health-Based Science': Experts On Air Quality Standards
content: In a move critics are calling a calculated deflection, the Union government has doubled down on its stance that World Health Organization (WHO) air quality guidelines are merely "guidance documents" and not enforceable rules.

title: UK Police Hunt Suspects After 600 British Empire Artefacts Stolen from Museum
content: More than 600 artefacts relating to the history of the British Empire and Commonwealth have been stolen from the collection of Bristol Museum, police said Thursday as they released images of four suspects.

title: Forcing Victim To Consume Acid Must Be Tried As Attempted Murder: Top Court
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday observed that acid-attackers must be tried under the provision of Attempt to Murder under penal laws, in cases where they are accused of forcibly making the victim ingest the acid.

title: PM Modi To Go On 3-Nation Tour To Jordan, Ethiopia, Oman From December 15
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will embark on a four-day visit to Jordan, Ethiopia and Oman from December 15, an official statement said.

title: 3 Men Die During Alleged Black Magic Ritual In Chhattisgarh
content: Three men died under mysterious circumstances during an alleged black magic ritual late Wednesday night in Chhattisgarh's Korba district.

title: World Bank Approves $305 Million For Haryana's Clean Air Project
content: The World Bank has approved a financial assistance package of USD 305 million for the Haryana Clean Air Project for Sustainable Development (HCAPSD), a flagship initiative aimed at transforming Haryana into a pollution-free state by 2030.

title: Satya Nadella Reveals He's Spending Free Time Designing A Cricket App
content: Microsoft Corp's Satya Nadella, a die-hard cricket fan, has been spending his free time coding and designing his own app that he uses to analyse the centuries-old game.

title: Gongura Paneer To Palakura Pappu: PM Modi's Dinner Menu For NDA MPs
content: Following the viral interest in the vegetarian meal served to Russian President Vladimir Putin, another all-vegetarian menu has caught the public's eye. This time, the spread was prepared for a special dinner hosted by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Five Anthony Davis trades, including a chaotic five-team blockbuster
content: With AD trade buzz ramping up, our experts propose five deals that could shift the league's balance of power.

title: Steelers' Watt at hospital having lung evaluated
content: Steelers star pass rusher T.J. Watt is in a local hospital for further lung evaluation after "experiencing discomfort" at the practice facility Wednesday, and his status for Monday's game against the Miami Dolphins is "in question."

title: Moore expected in court Fri., remains in custody
content: Fired Michigan football coach Sherrone Moore, who remains in custody as a suspect in an alleged assault, is expected to appear in court for arraignment on Friday.

title: Former Padres closer Suarez signs with Braves
content: Former Padres closer Robert Suarez has signed a three-year, $45 million contract with the Atlanta Braves, the team announced Thursday..

title: NASCAR, 2 race teams settle federal antitrust case
content: NASCAR has reached a settlement of the bruising antitrust lawsuit filed against it by two of its race teams, including one co-owned by NBA great Michael Jordan.

title: Grizz's Edey (ankle) to be reevaluated in 4 weeks
content: Grizzlies center Zach Edey will be reevaluated in four weeks with a stress reaction in the left ankle he had surgically repaired in the offseason.

title: Ravens, DT Jones reach extension before hearing
content: The Ravens reached a three-year extension with Travis Jones on Thursday, avoiding a grievance on whether the starting nose tackle would become an unrestricted free agent at the end of the season.

title: Signed Kobe card fetches $1.22 million at auction
content: A 2003-04 Upper Deck Exquisite Collection Emblems of Endorsements card of Kobe Bryant recently sold for $1.22 million, including buyer's premium, with Goldin Auctions.

title: IOC: Allow Russian youths to compete with flag
content: The IOC took a big step toward reintegrating Russia and Belarus into world sports Thursday by advising governing bodies to let the countries' youth teams and athletes compete with their full identity of national flag and anthem.

title: 🏈 2026 NFL draft: Yates' first-round projections
content: Which teams need a quarterback? Could Ohio State dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the opening 32 picks of next year's draft.

title: MLB winter meetings winners, losers and head-scratching moves
content: Now that the dust has settled in Orlando, we debate our favorite (and least favorite) moves of the week -- and what's ahead this offseason.

title: What to make of the Mets losing Pete Alonso, Edwin Diaz on back-to-back days
content: Losing two faces of the franchise to free agency might feel like a gut punch, but is it a disaster for the Mets?

title: The NFL's best player through 14 games is ...? Barnwell stacks 15 MVP candidates and picks the winner
content: Let's make the MVP cases for 15 players -- including a ranking of the top five. Can anyone catch Matthew Stafford or Drake Maye?

title: Fowler and Graziano: Buzz on Daniel Jones, falling contenders and head coach candidates
content: What effect will Jones' injury have on the offseason QB market? Here's the latest intel heading into Week 15.

title: How a 28-year-old Chris Weinke became one of the most unlikely Heisman winners ever
content: After leaving pro baseball, the quarterback ignited a debate about whether his age was helping him tear up college football.

title: NHL trade tiers: Could we see another superstar on the move?
content: Here's a way-too-early look at the shocking superstar possibilities, pending free agents and overlooked gems.

title: Which NHL player and team trends are for real? The trend-o-meter for all 32
content: From Morgan Geekie's scoring rate to the "Wall of St. Paul" and more, here's what will and won't continue.

title: WNBA expansion draft: Predicting the five protected players on every roster
content: Teams are expected to be able to protect five players in the Portland Fire and Toronto Tempo WNBA expansion draft.

title: Jason Collins, on his cancer diagnosis: It's Stage 4 glioblastoma and I'm fighting
content: In an exclusive with ESPN, the 13-year NBA veteran and pioneer reveals that he is fighting for his life.

title: For Nebraska's Dani Busboom Kelly, home is where you hang a banner
content: Replacing legendary coach and mentor John Cook was just a step on her path to building a legend of her own.

title: Power Rankings: The 4-team race for No. 1
content: Arizona, Duke, Michigan and Iowa State each have legitimate cases to top this week's edition. Which prevailed?

title: 5 early lessons: Real vs. pretend contenders, more
content: Michigan is better than expected. Kentucky is worse. And Duke headlines an ACC that looks as if it's "back."

title: Wetzel: Beware, college sports, private equity has arrived
content: The University of Utah approved a groundbreaking private equity deal. Dan Wetzel writes that big changes could follow.

title: Pulisic's form and fitness make him undroppable for the USMNT at 2026 World Cup
content: Christian Pulisic is Serie A's leading scorer, despite playing only 446 minutes. The U.S. can't afford to leave that kind of player on the bench.

title: Arsenal No. 1, Man City rising, Napoli in trouble? Champions League rerank after Matchday 6
content: Big teams have learned from last season to take the league phase more seriously, with several heavyweights cruising into the Champions League knockouts. Let's recap the surprises and rankings after Matchday 6.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Royval's path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Where's the value on the final UFC fight card of the year? MMA insiders and a betting expert make their picks for Brandon Royval vs. Manel Kape.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 15
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Buzz: DK Metcalf expected to play Monday following injury scare
content: Metcalf (abdomen) didn't return with the Steelers after Sunday's game and instead was sent to a hospital.

title: Brady Cook to start? Jets could do something at QB they haven't done in 50 years
content: If Tyrod Taylor and Justin Fields can't go, New York will start its first undrafted rookie since 1975.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Hart, Bridges are among top 25 players this season
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Jaren Jackson Jr. and key New York Knicks.

title: Chris Paul's 'get-better mentality' paved the way for OKC's dominance
content: Paul spent only one season in OKC but left a lasting impression on reigning MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: NBA Power Rankings: What is each team's biggest weakness?
content: NBA insiders break down the latest Power Rankings, evaluating all 30 teams as the Emirates NBA Cup heats up.

title: Predicting the top 5 picks in the 2026 MLB draft after White Sox win lottery
content: With Chicago landing the No. 1 overall pick for next summer, let's see how the start of the first round could go down.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea and Real Madrid eye Nottingham Forest's Murillo
content: Real Madrid and Chelsea are monitoring Nottingham Forest defender Murillo. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: US plan for Russia-Ukraine peace: Europe bristles; why it may be a boon for India
content: the proposals set out an ambitious postwar reconstruction program for Ukraine funded by frozen Russian assets, and a roadmap for returning Russia to the global economy through extensive US-led investment . one proposal calls for building a vast US-operated data-center complex powered by the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant, currently under Russian occupation .

title: Taliban, TTP & Balochistan: The three-body problem facing Pak - explained
content: the reality is far more chaotic and intricate, much like the scientific conundrum known as the "three-body problem" this problem deals with predicting the motions of three gravitational bodies interacting with each other . the paradox is that introducing a third body creates a system so unstable and non-linear that exact forecasts become practically impossible .

title: Bucs' Creamsicles, Falcons' throwbacks top Week 15 uniforms
content: the Buccaneers will wear their popular "Creamsicle" uniforms against the Atlanta Falcons on "Thursday Night Football" the combination has the iconic "Bucco Bruce" logo on the white helmets . the new york Giants wore these uniforms from 1980 to 1999 .

title: Ten (maybe 11) players to watch at NCAA volleyball tournament's Sweet 16
content: the 2025 NCAA volleyball tournament is down to its final 16 teams . can Nebraska, the no. 1 overall seed, finish undefeated and claim the program's sixth national title? will Kentucky return to the final four for the first time since winning its first national championship in 2020?

title: Men's class rankings: USC into top 10; Tennessee and Texas A&M join
content: the biggest winner of this most recent update was USC . both of their signees made enormous leaps in the player rankings . the Trojans jumped from no. 24 all the way to no. 9 despite not adding any commitments .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: The most impactful women's recruit on every 2026 top-25 class roster
content: a look at the most impactful signee in each of the nation's top recruiting classes . the top scouts have a clearer picture of what next season will look like for many of them . last year, no one has done star power like USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb .

title: Philip Rivers could join exclusive list of athletes to suit up while being a grandparent
content: rivers retired from professional football after a 17-year career . he will be re-signing with the Indianapolis Colts . rivers' eldest daughter is a few months older than the 23-year-old rookie .

title: In a lost season, Falcons' rookie pass rushers offer hope for the future
content: two players from the same place who play the same position were both drafted by the same team in the first round . "Knew this was home for us," pearce says . the Falcons are hoping to make a move to the u.s. in 2025 .

title: Don't turn Liverpool chaos into Slot vs. Salah: Club bosses must step in
content: the current situation at the club is being framed in the simplest terms: Mohamed Salah vs. Arne Slot . it feels downright puerile, something straight out of the schoolyard, with fans and media playing the role of parents . slot blames little Mo for his student's poor test scores and kicks him out of class .

title: Everything Shams is hearing on NBA trade season: Where could Davis land?
content: 82 players signed in the offseason will become trade-eligible . 90% of the league can be moved . a top team executive says this is the "unofficial start to having real, high-stakes conversations" "this is the unofficial start" to having high stakes conversations, he says .

title: Odisha CM gives away citizenship certificates to 35 persons from Bangladesh
content: The CAA-2019 is sacred law which is hope and assurance for persecuted minorities, said Odisha CM Mohan Majhi

title: BJP leader’s gaffe over Matangini Hazra gives Trinamool a fresh handle
content: Criticising Dinesh Sharma, who was Deputy Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh, Trinamool Congress said, “demonstrates that political rank does not equate to knowledge”.

title: Arunachal road deaths: Kharge asks for just compensation to bereaved; saddening, says Rahul
content: The accident was not reported by any local agency, contractor, or civil representative until the lone survivor's arrival, Rawat said, adding that 18 bodies had been sighted.

title: Question on delay in scheme reveals rift in Mahayuti
content: Planning Dept., under NCP, raised objections to hike in prize money, says Minister from Shiv Sena; good schemes hit because of internal fight: Cong.

title: Official team will study feasibility of additional commissinerate for Bengaluru: Home Minister
content: The Minister says additional commissionerates had been set up in the cities of Mumbai, New Delhi and Hyderabad

title: Crime against women: Odisha police launch digital platform
content: Keonjhar police have come up with digital interface to enable women to file complaints from their home

title: Over 2.24 crore palmyrah seeds planted under Green Tamil Nadu Mission
content: Several districts — including Perambalur, Tiruchirappalli, Pudukkottai, Ariyalur, Tirupathur and Sivagangai — have each crossed the 10-lakh mark in seed plantations

title: VIT rejects govt report allegations, blames campus violence on misinformation
content: It claimed that 35 cases of jaundice had been reported out of over 17,000 students. Several students, however, have alleged that the University authorities had asked many who showed symptoms to go home

title: 2.5 lakh workers registered under SPREE in A.P., says ESIC official
content: Employers and workers can register through Shram Suvidha, ESIC or MCA portals by December 31, says ESIC State Regional Director Malla Rama Rao

title: A.P. Cabinet approves proposals worth ₹9,500 crore; Lok Bhavan and Assembly Darbar Hall projects cleared
content: 14 major industrial proposals with investments exceeding ₹15,000 crore in SEZs, manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, MSMEs, renewable energy, and agro-processing get Cabinet nod

title: A.P. Cabinet approves DA hike for govt. employees, State Water Action Plan
content: The Cabinet clears draft of A.P. Prisons and Correctional Services Act, 2025 intended to replace the outdated Central laws of 1894 with a modern correctional framework

title: Devotees throng Indrakeedari in Vijayawada as Bhavani Deeksha Viramana begins
content: Over 43,800 devotees visit the temple on the first day, while 5,618 devotees tonsure their heads; mobile app to share detailed information about the 9 km Giripradakshina route

title: AVGC-XR sector holds much potential for youth in A.P., says RTIH CEO
content: Ratan Tata Innovation Hub has partnered with A.P. VFX, Animation, Gaming Association to offer hands-on learning, industry exposure, and startup pathways for students and creators, says its CEO

title: More than 4 lakh students trained in self-defence in A.P., says DGP
content: Self-defence training has been imparted to students in 12,873 schools and 1,315 colleges in the State, says Harish Kumar Gupta VIJAYAWADA

title: Biennale welcomes visitors to experience art with all the senses
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to inaugurate the sixth edition of Kochi-Muziris Biennale, themed ‘For the Time Being’, on December 12; event to showcase works of 66 artists from 25 countries

title: The Madras High Court must break its silence
content: The High Court must clarify whether the method of the Collegium’s recommendations in the case of recent judicial appointments was in accordance with the Constitution and the Memorandum of Procedure

title: Rohini Acharya’s post again fuels talk of crisis in Lalu’s family
content: The deeply entrenched patriarchal mindset in Bihar creates the necessity for comprehensive social and political reforms; every young and adult woman should feel assured that her paternal home is a safe place --- one where she can return without fear, guilt or shame, the post read

title: ICC of survivor's office has jurisdiction in POSH plaint, not accused's, says Supreme Court
content: a bench of justices said the aggrieved woman should not be compelled to file a complaint before the ICC constituted at the workplace of the 'respondent' it rejected the plea of a 2010-batch IRS officer who alleged the inquiry against him be conducted only by ICC of his department . the alleged incident happened in 2023 .

title: Action will be taken against filmmaker Kunju Muhammed, says Chalachithra Academy Vice Chairperson
content: Police registered a case against him on charge of molesting a woman associated with the film industry while staying at a hotel as part of the Malayalam movie selection process for IFFK

title: Slave compounds in Myanmar, adjoining regions are hubs for execution of digital arrest frauds: CBI
content: The Central agency has filed a charge sheet against 13 accused persons in a major digital arrest case; it found that several key bank accounts used for receiving money from victims and routing the funds were being controlled by masterminds based in Cambodia, Hong Kong, and China

title: Supreme Court constitutes SIT to probe unnatural death of Scheduled Caste youth in Madhya Pradesh
content: The deceased’s widow and brother gave conflicting statements about who was responsible for the tragedy.

title: Supreme Court declines to transfer trial of Prajwal Revanna
content: Counsel sought the transfer on the basis of certain observations made by Special Judge in his August 1 judgment convicting Revanna in an earlier sexual assault case

title: Supreme Court panel to conceptualise, implement, monitor AI use in judiciary, Law Minister tells RS
content: e-Courts project includes ₹53.57 cr for future tech, including AI and blockchain; AI tools to boost administrative efficiency, predict case pendency, automate processes, streamline court operations, Minister says

title: PM Modi to visit Jordan, Ethiopia, Oman from December 15 to 18
content: In the first leg of his trip, PM Modi will visit Jordan from December 15 to 16 at the invitation of King Abdullah II bin Al Hussein to review the entire gamut of bilateral relations and exchange perspectives on regional issues.

title: Srinagar homestay owner booked for hosting Chinese national
content: The police lodged a FIR (First Information Report) under Sections 8 and 23(b) of the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025

title: 76.08% vote in second phase of local body polls,  Kerala records overall turnout of 73.69%
content: Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasaragod went to the polls on Thursday (December 11) and 1.16 crore of the 1.53 crore voters in these districts exercised their right to vote.

title: Kozhikode records 77.24% voter turnout in local body polls
content: Kozhikode Corporation registered 69.55% polling; Ramanattukara posted the highest polling percentage of 81.39 among municipalities, while Payyoli recorded the lowest  of 76.53%

title: Five gau rakshaks held for beating digital creator over feeding chicken to a cow; victim also held
content: Gurugram Police spokesperson said that Ritik Chandna had accepted a challenge to eat a hundred momos and was live streaming it when he fed the chicken momos to a cow at the request of an audience member

title: Supreme Court says ‘migration’ in SIR order may include illegal crossings into India
content: Bench questions scope of Election Commission’s citizenship verification under nationwide SIR exercise

title: Government denies Rahul Gandhi’s charge on exclusion of the marginalised from top posts
content: Sources confirmed that for the eight vacancies as Information Commissioners, the government had recommended one name from the SC community, one from the ST community, one member from the Other Backward Classes and a member of a minority community, and a woman

title: Indian Medical Parliamentarians’ Forum flags acute crisis in care for children with rare lysosomal disorders
content: In a submission to Prime Minister, the forum has warned that treatment interruptions under the National Policy for Rare Diseases have placed dozens of young patients at immediate and preventable risk

title: President Murmu visits Manipur amid shutdown
content: After the capital of the conflict-scarred State, she is scheduled to visit Senapati district to inaugurate various developmental projects

title: NIMHANS paper highlights role of digital tools in strengthening campus mental health systems
content: The publication says higher education institutions must put in place clear policies on data governance, privacy and confidentiality, and ensure transparency around digital offerings

title: Watch: Historic chaos in Maharashtra Assembly: No opposition leader for the first time
content: In this episode of Pulse Maharashtra, we decode the unprecedented turmoil in the winter session: why both Houses currently lack an LOP, how the 10% convention is being interpreted, and what the number game looks like (Shiv Sena UBT, Congress, NCP–SP).

title: Redeploy non-Hindus in non-religious positions, government tells TTD
content: The TTD administration is also contemplating introducing Voluntary Retirement Scheme by working out a lucrative package for them

title: Punishment for forcibly administering acid must be stricter than under UAPA : SC
content: “These people who exhibit such barbarism on a fellow human being have no right to roam around in society; they are a threat to society and to the rule of the law,” says Chief Justice Surya Kant

title: 3 dead in Chhattisgarh after occult ritual goes wrong
content: The victims had asked the tantrik and his accomplices to conduct a jhadan, an occult procedure, which multiplies money

title: Palakkad sees 76.23% voter turnout
content: Among the seven municipalities in the district, Chittur-Thathamangalam municipality registers highest polling percentage at 81.41%, while the  Palakkad municipality registers the lowest polling percentage at 65.08%

title: TTD mulls expansion of recycling machines in Tirumala
content: Swachh Tirumala must evolve into a collective civic movement, says TTD Additional Executive Officer Ch. Venkaiah Chowdary

title: DPIIT signals Copyright Act changes to address AI issues
content: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade proposes ‘blanket licensing’, to let AI firms train LLMs by scraping the Internet, pay royalties once models are commercialised; firms say publishers should be able to opt out from data sharing

title: Info from Tasmac MD’s mobile phone revealed involvement of Akash Baskaran, ED tells Madras High Court
content: It, however, adds that all action related to Tasmac money laundering probe had been put on hold pursuant to interim orders passed by the Supreme Court

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu promises support to Amaravati Quantum BioFoundry
content: He reaffirms the government’s commitment to promote frontier technologies and provide conditions that attract global investments and innovation

title: Startup ideas must meet global standards: SVU RUSA CEO
content: Students asked to explore new entrepreneurial opportunities by utilising creativity and skills instead of depending solely on traditional job roles

title: A.P. achieves record paddy procurement, says Civil Supplies Minister Nadendla Manohar
content: A quantity of 1,71,651 MT of paddy has already been despatched to the Food Corporation of India, he says
